tool.name: IDMapper
tool.description: Assigns protein/peptide identifications to features or consensus features.
tool.command:
IDMapper
#if $param_id: -id $param_id #end if #if $param_in: -in $param_in #end if #if $param_out: -out $param_out #end if #if $param_rt_tolerance: -rt_tolerance $param_rt_tolerance #end if #if $param_mz_tolerance: -mz_tolerance $param_mz_tolerance #end if #if $param_mz_measure: -mz_measure $param_mz_measure #end if #if $param_mz_reference: -mz_reference $param_mz_reference #end if #if $param_ignore_charge: -ignore_charge #end if #if $param_feature_use_centroid_rt: -feature:use_centroid_rt #end if #if $param_feature_use_centroid_mz: -feature:use_centroid_mz #end if #if $param_consensus_use_subelements: -consensus:use_subelements #end if #if $adv_opts.adv_opts_selector=='advanced': #if $adv_opts.param_force: -force #end if #if $adv_opts.param_consensus_annotate_ids_with_subelements: -consensus:annotate_ids_with_subelements #end if #end if

param.name: param_rt_tolerance
param.label: RT tolerance (in seconds) for the matching of peptide identifications and (consensus) features
param.help:
(-rt_tolerance)
Tolerance is understood as 'plus or minus x', so the matching range increases by twice the given value

param.name: param_mz_tolerance
param.label: m/z tolerance (in ppm or Da) for the matching of peptide identifications and (consensus) features
param.help:
(-mz_tolerance)
Tolerance is understood as 'plus or minus x', so the matching range increases by twice the given value

param.name: param_mz_reference
param.label: Source of m/z values for peptide identifications
param.help:
(-mz_reference) If 'precursor', the precursor-m/z from the idXML is used. If 'peptide',
masses are computed from the sequences of peptide hits; in this case, an identification matches if any of its hits matches.
('peptide' should be used together with 'feature:use_centroid_mz' to avoid false-positive matches.)

param.name: param_ignore_charge
param.label: For feature/consensus maps: Assign an ID independently of whether its charge state matches that of the (consensus) feature

param.name: param_feature_use_centroid_rt
param.label: Use the RT coordinates of the feature centroids for matching, instead of the RT ranges of the features/mass traces

param.name: param_feature_use_centroid_mz
param.label: Use the m/z coordinates of the feature centroids for matching, instead of the m/z ranges of the features/mass traces
param.help:
(-use_centroid_mz)
(If you choose 'peptide' as 'mz_reference', you should usually set this flag to avoid false-positive matches.)

param.name: param_consensus_use_subelements
param.label: Match using RT and m/z of sub-features instead of consensus RT and m/z
param.help: (-use_subelements) A consensus feature matches if any of its sub-features matches

param.name: param_consensus_annotate_ids_with_subelements
param.label: Store the map index of the sub-feature in the peptide ID

tool.help:
Assigns protein/peptide identifications to features or consensus features.
For more information, visit http://ftp.mi.fu-berlin.de/OpenMS/release-documentation/html/TOPP_IDMapper.html
